radiographic_examinations.findings: marked right thoracic spinal scoliosis and nonspecific focal uptake of technetium-99m-labeled methylene diphosphonate within the right iliac crest and left distal radius, consistent with degenerative joint disease
no evidence of recurrent or metastatic carcinoma

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: no evidence of recurrent or metastatic carcinoma
extensive skeletal uptake of technetium-99m-labeled methylene diphosphonate, consistent with widespread bone metastases
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: showed new bone metastases two years after the patient resumed androgen deprivation therapy
